page.title: 02LAXDALE HOUSING PART 1
page.content: Laxdale is primarily a rural district and a crofting township. This leads to the majority of the houses having a certain defined architectural pattern as laid down by the{Crofters' {Commission.}This Commission is the main governing body of the crofters. It issues grants and low-interest loans to crofters to help them build new homes and carry out improvements to older ones. The pre-war 1930 houses are of the two- storey villa-type design. The recently built houses are of the one-storey bungalow design. All the crofting land in the district is owned by a body called the{Stornoway Trust}from whom the crofter rents his land. Thus the majority of the house-holders in the area are tenants.
